gRips 0.1.3
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • 01 - Introduction to 'gRips'

    Fit Gaussian graphical models

    fit-ggm.Rd

    Fit Gaussian graphical models using various algorithms.

    fit_ggm(
  S,
  edges = NULL,
  nobs,
  K = NULL,
  iter = 10000L,
  eps = 1e-06,
  convcrit = 1,
  aux = list(),
  method = "covips",
  print = 0
)

    Arguments

    S

    Sample covariance matrix.

    edges

    Generators of model; a list of integer vectors or a 2 x p matrix of integers.

    nobs

    Number of observations

    K

    Initial value of concentration matrix.

    iter

    Maximum number of iterations.

    eps

    Convergence criterion.

    convcrit

    Convergence criterions. See section `details`.

    aux

    A list of form name=value.

    method

    Either `"ips"` or `"fips"`.

    print

    Should output from fitting be printed?

    Details

    Convergence criterion:

    * 1: max absolute difference between S and Sigmahat on edges.

    * 2: difference in log likelihood divided by number of parameters in the model (number of edges + number of nodes) between successive iterations.

    R-based / c++-based in combination with con / cov.

    Author

    Søren Højsgaard, sorenh@math.aau.dk

    Examples

    options("digits"=3)
data(math)

S <- cov(math)
nobs <- nrow(math)
gl <- list(1:3, 3:5)
em <- matrix(c(1,2, 2,3, 1,3, 3,4, 3,5, 4,5), nrow=2)

EPS = 1e-2

cg = fit_ggm(S, gl, nobs=nobs, eps=EPS, method="cov")
ci = fit_ggm(S, gl, nobs=nobs, eps=EPS, method="con")
rg = fit_ggm(S, gl, nobs=nobs, eps=EPS, method="cov", aux=list(engine="R"))
ri = fit_ggm(S, gl, nobs=nobs, eps=EPS, method="con", aux=list(engine="R"))

K <- solve(S)
(ci$K - K)  %>% abs %>% max
#> [1] 0.00154
(cg$K - K)  %>% abs %>% max
#> [1] 0.00154
(ri$K - K)  %>% abs %>% max
#> [1] 0.00154
(rg$K - K)  %>% abs %>% max
#> [1] 0.00154
